intro.title: Profile
intro.introduction: I'm Yongjin Huang (黄勇进 in Chinese), a software developer with a passion for coding and technology. In my free time, you can find me listening to hip-hop music, watching entertainment videos, playing video games, and of course, coding.

tarro.name: Tarro
responsibilities: Responsible for the backend development of the restaurant POS software, ensuring the system’s performance, scalability, and reliability.

Designed the data structure of the order module to facilitate smooth and efficient order management. This included supporting operations such as order creation, updates, retrieval, and real-time status tracking to meet the business requirements of a fast-paced restaurant environment
Define and implement the API for the POS ordering
Migrate the menu data from the legacy POS system

shopee.name: Shopee
responsibilities: Responsible for the overall technical solution design
Acted as the project PIC, controlled the project progress, scheduled and divided the tasks, and promptly managed risks, successfully delivering the project on time
Acted as the Code Review PIC for the team and regularly organized weekly CR review meetings, effectively improving the team's code quality
Optimized the performance of the billing API, The number of db connections was reduced from 4k+ to 1k+, and the single machine-supported QPS increased from 2k+ to 5k+
Actively shared technical knowledge and gave 5 internal presentations

huawei.name: Huawei
responsibilities: Independently designed, developed, tested, deployed, and launched the middleware CodeHubEdge, enabling internal interfaces to be opened to third-party services.
Responsible for writing, optimizing, testing, and maintaining business code related to code repository operations.
Read GitLab source code and blogs during the job and output a series of GitLab-related blog posts.
